Мнемоника

Беременная женщина 女 ощущает в себе трепет 辰 плода.

rtega_mnemonic:
娠娠RSpregnant
  • lucky and fortunate 辰 woman 女: pregnant
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 辰 indicates the sound; 女 (woman) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
妊娠 [ rèn shēn ]: pregnancy; gestation
妊娠试验 [ rèn shēn shì yàn ]: pregnancy test
四胎妊娠 [ sì tāi rèn shēn ]: quadruplet pregnancy (idiom)
多胎妊娠 [ duō tāi rèn shēn ]: multiple pregnancy
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 女 [ nǚ ] woman, girl; female
    • 辰 [ chén ] early morning; fortune, good luck; 5th terrestrial branch
heisig_constituent: with child, woman, sign of the dragon, cliff, two, hairpin, safety-pin
heisig_story: Woman . . . sign of the dragon. The key word is a synonym for pregnant, whose character we met earlier (Frame 546). Although the two kanji are often used together, they should be kept distinct.
koohiiStory1: A woman who is with child can't be sacrificed to the dragon; virgins only need apply.
koohiiStory2: The woman hides the dragon from poachers under her shirt, pretending she's with child. "Seen any sign of the dragon?" ask the poachers. "Nope, haven't seen him," replies the woman.
jp_example_words: 妊娠(にんしん): conception, pregnancy
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A woman who has a landslide getting ready inside her is pregnant. And that baby is gonna come out like a landslide.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture an ultrasound of the pregnant woman, but instead of a little baby heartbeat, you hear a scary roaring sound. That's what being pregnant is like. Waiting for the landslide to come.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: When you're pregnant the baby is constantly kicking you with their shins (しん). Not their feet, their shins. And shins are really hard, let me tell you.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine being pregnant and getting kicked by the shins of you baby all day, but especially all night. You're so tired. Please let this landslide come already.
Ru_Notes: Используется почти только в слове 妊娠 [にんしん]. См. также: 妊 (はらむ、ニン беременность)
Ru_Radicals: 厂 (скала), 女 (женщина), 衣 (одежда), 辰 (знак Дракона)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the woman (女) by the dragon (辰) is with child
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from " female " from " chen ", suspected to be used as a woman's name. Xiaozhuan's original meaning is pregnancy from the sound of " female " and " chen ".

Oracle speech disabled, women were used as a suspect, "collection" 14070: "...... pregnant that Kerry" the ancients to a boy as " Ka ", a girl is "not Kerry."

"Shu Wen": "Pregnant, pregnant women move. From women, Chen Sheng. "Chuan Qiu Biography" says: "Hou Yu Fang is pregnant." First, the maidservant is called pregnancy." Duan Yucai's note: "Fan The word Congchen has the meaning of movement, shock and vibration. Pregnancy while the body is moving means pregnancy, and other words are also. If the words are verbal, pregnancy is not different." In ancient books handed down, it is used as the original meaning of pregnancy, "Zuo Zhuan. "The First Year of Ai A.D.": "Hou Sha Fang became pregnant, escaped from the sinus, returned to the existence, and gave birth to Shao Kang Yan." Du pre-note: "Pregnant, pregnant."

In addition, "Shuowen" has another meaning, which means that " pregnancy " can be interpreted as a maidservant or a slave maid. This statement is also seen in "Dialects": "The idle horse breeder in Yanqi is called pregnant, and the official servant girl is called pregnant."
humanum_short_description_en: " pregnant " from " female ", " e " sound, the original meaning is pregnant.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「女」從「辰」，疑用作婦名。小篆從「女」，「辰」聲，本義是懷孕。

　　甲骨文辭殘，疑用作婦名，《合集》14070：「……娠其嘉。」古人以生男為「嘉」，生女為「不嘉」。

　　《說文》：「娠，女妊身動也。从女，辰聲。《春秋傳》曰：『后緡方娠。』一曰宮婢女隸謂之娠。」段玉裁注：「凡从辰之字皆有動意，震、振是也。妊而身動曰娠，別詞也。渾言之則妊娠不別。」傳世古書中有用作本義，指懷孕，《左傳．哀公元年》：「后緍方娠，逃出自竇，歸于有仍，生少康焉。」杜預注：「娠，懷身也。」

　　又《說文》另收一義，指「娠」可解為宮婢、奴婢。這種說法亦見於《方言》：「燕齊之閒養馬者謂之娠，官婢女廝謂之娠。」

妊娠(にんしん): conception, pregnancy

甲骨文從「 女 」從「 辰 」，疑用作婦名。小篆從「 女 」，「 辰 」聲，本義是懷孕。 甲骨文辭殘，疑用作婦名，《合集》14070：「……娠其嘉。」古人以生男為「 嘉 」，生女為「不嘉」。 《說文》：「娠，女妊身動也。从女，辰聲。《春秋傳》曰：『后緡方娠。』一曰宮婢女隸謂之娠。」段玉裁注：「凡从辰之字皆有動意，震、振是也。妊而身動曰娠，別詞也。渾言之則妊娠不別。」傳世古書中有用作本義，指懷孕，《左傳．哀公元年》：「后緍方娠，逃出自竇，歸于有仍，生少康焉。」杜預注：「娠，懷身也。」 又《說文》另收一義，指「 娠 」可解為宮婢、奴婢。這種說法亦見於《方言》：「燕齊之閒養馬者謂之娠，官婢女廝謂之娠。」

"Shu Wen": "Pregnant, pregnant women move. From women, Chen Sheng. "Chuan Qiu Biography" says: "Hou Yu Fang is pregnant." First, the maidservant is called pregnancy." Duan Yucai's note: "Fan The word Congchen has the meaning of movement, shock and vibration. Pregnancy while the body is moving means pregnancy, and other words are also. If the words are verbal, pregnancy is not different." In ancient books handed down, it is used as the original meaning of pregnancy, "Zuo Zhuan. "The First Year of Ai A.D.": "Hou Sha Fang became pregnant, escaped from the sinus, returned to the existence, and gave birth to Shao Kang Yan." Du pre-note: "Pregnant, pregnant." In addition, "Shuowen" has another meaning, which means that " pregnancy" can be interpreted as a maidservant or a slave maid. 娠字的基本解释

娠
shēn
胎儿在母体中微动，泛指怀孕：妊娠（怀孕）。

娠字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shēn］
［《廣韻》失人切，平真，書。］
［《廣韻》章刃切，去震，章。］
“震2”的被通假字。
(1)怀孕。
(2)包孕；包含。

娠字的康熙字典解释

【丑集下】【女字部】　娠； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页263第01
【廣韻】失人切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】升人切，?音申。【說文】女妊身動也。【左傳·哀元年】后緡方娠。　又【集韻】之刃切，音震。義同。通作身。　又【正韻】之人切，音眞。【揚子·方言】燕齊之閒，養馬者及官婢女厮通謂之娠，亦曰侲。

娠字的起名意思

怀孕 。

Name meaning
Pregnancy.
娠
形声字。女表意,篆书之形像一位隐跪着的女子,表示和女子有关;辰(chen)表声,辰有振动一义,表示胎儿在母体中
微动。本义是胎儿在母体中微动。引申为怀孕。

娠
隶

беременная
Пиктофонетические символы.
Женщина выражает смысл, сценарий печати подобен женщине на коленях, указывая на то, что он связан с женщиной; Чен выражает звук, чен имеет то же значение вибрации, что означает, что плод слегка двигается в теле матери.
Первоначальное значение состоит в том, что плод слегка двигается в теле матери.
Продление - беременность.

shēn
1) забеременеть; беременная
后缗方娠 императрица Минь была в то время беременна
娠妇 беременная женщина
2) устар. служанка, прислуга (у чиновника)
Radicals: 女, 辰  (woman, landslide)
Meaning Mnemonic
A woman who has a landslide getting ready inside her is pregnant. And that baby is gonna come out like a landslide.
Picture an ultrasound of the pregnant woman, but instead of a little baby heartbeat, you hear a scary roaring sound. That's what being pregnant is like. Waiting for the landslide to come.
Reading Mnemonic
When you're pregnant the baby is constantly kicking you with their shins (しん). Not their feet, their shins. And shins are really hard, let me tell you.
Imagine being pregnant and getting kicked by the shins of you baby all day, but especially all night. You're so tired. Please let this landslide come already.
